text: START ON THE FACE of A GOLDEN CAT STATUE. This is the cat god BAST, lithe, noble, beautiful. CAMERA MOVES to reveal the statue is 50 feet tall, dominating this space. Other images of CATS -- hieroglyphics, ceramics -- abound, as d REAL CATS, hundreds of them, slinking in the shadows on r cut into the sandstone walls of this Egyptian temple. At Bast's feet, EIGHT ACOLYTES in GOWNS kneel in a semi- circle around a flaming BRAZIER. Some of the women WEEP, others PRAY or stare stoically ahead. From outside, we no hear DISTANT SCREAMS, the sounds of MARAUDERS. There's a RHYTHMIC BANGING at the massive BRONZE TEMPLE DOORS.
THE TEMPLE is an impressive place of worship -- tapered columns and an ornate Egyptian facade -- at the apex of a hilltop VILLAGE, in FLAMES, under ATTACK by a PERSIAN ARM
WHAM! THE STEEL PRONG of a mounted BATTERING RAM swings i the ornate DOORS of the temple. PERSIAN SOLDIERS operate brutal siege engine, SLAM the doors again and again.

The HIGH PRIESTESS wears a special HOODED WHITE GOWN that mostly conceals her face. She moves from one ACOLYTE to t next, pours a DARK LIQUID from a bejeweled decanter into golden goblets, then pours one for herself. She raises he goblet toward BAST, as do the others -- they drink in uni HIGH ANGLE as the GOBLETS CLATTER to the floor and the WO SLUMP to the ground... dead. PULL BACK -- we're watching this from the PERSPECTIVE of an EGYPTIAN MAU CAT -- slim, elegant, dark-spotted gray and black fur, a SCARAB MARK o its head. (CONTINUED )

THE MAU lets out a CRY... which prompts an eerie, growing CHORUS of MEOWS and HOWLS from the other CATS. THE CATS emerge from the hiding places en masse, leaping niches, converging on the bodies. The MAU leads the way, moves to the high priestess and puts its mouth to hers... ON THE TEMPLE DOORS - at last they BUCKLE and swing open. THE SOLDIERS, bearing TORCHES and SWORDS, storm inside. T grab anything of value, SMASH and DEFACE everything else. At the foot of BAST lie nine ROBES... but there's no sign the women who wore them. SOLDIERS slash the robes with th swords anyway, then snatch up the goblets for booty. An unearthly CRY -- half-human, half-feline -- from somew high above the rampaging soldiers. They freeze, looking around frantically. More EERIE CRIES echo off the walls, from all directions. The SOLDIERS raise their weapons, clustering defensively. From out of the shadows above the DARK HUMAN FORMS suddenly leap down with impossible agili STAY ON THE FACE OF BAST, peering down impassively. The torch-cast SHADOWS of the violence below play upon the statue's golden surface... FLAILING SWORDS, the swift SILHOUETTES of NAKED WOMEN. We hear the GUTTURAL CRIES of the soldiers, clearly outmatched in this mortal combat. MOVE TO THE CATS, perched above the fray, looking downwar they pace the temple's ledges and ramps excitedly. THE MA takes a final look at its handiwork, then leaps up, slink through a crevice at the roof, and emerges on -- cut TO:
We hear the modern SOUNDS of passing AUTO TRAFFIC. CAMERA ROTATES to reveal --
THE MAU settles by a SATELLITE DISH, looking down on a present-day suburban street, a busy main drag. MARSHLAND WATER are visible not far away, light RAIN FALLS. (CONTINUED )

The MAU watches as, ACROSS THE STREET, a BUS pulls away f the curb to reveal a WOMAN in a HOODED WHITE PONCHO -- the outfit recalls the high priestess of Bast. The HOOD is thrown back, revealing PATIENCE PRICE, 25-35, attractive but inclined to conceal her looks -- hair over face, baggy clothes under her poncho. She's cautious, eag to please, to do what's expected of her -- a bit of a doormat. Patience looks up from an address scribbled on a scrap of paper, and straight toward the cat on the roof -- almost if she'd sensed its presence. She smiles. THE MAU holds her gaze for a beat, then slinks out of sig

An eccentric, ramshackle home amongst neat, well-kept hou PATIENCE moves to the front door, RINGS. As she waits, sh notes the lawn GRASS grown high, CLIMBING CAT SCULPTURES the shingles. A SIGN by the door: "FELINE RESCUE SOCIETY. EDNA POWERS opens the door on a chain. She's 50-70, a for academic, intelligent, charming, but quite intimidating.
Yes?
Hi, Edna Powers? (off her nod) I'm Patience Price, I called about adopting a cat? I saw your flyer at my vet's office --
Oh yes, do come inside. EDNA undoes the chain, opens the door for her.
PATIENCE, out of her poncho, fills out a questionnaire on clipboard. Numerous CATS roam the premises. Feline artwor and curios, scratching posts, furry toys... cat paradise. (CONTINUED)
-+. Ma'am? EDNA is putting out DRY CAT FOOD in numerous BOWLS.
You may call me Edna.
Edna. Some of these questions are... kind of personal. Do you really need to know how many, um, partners I've had in the past year?
I'm not interested in your love life. But I do want to know what sort of home environment you're offering, your degree of commitment...

Guess I wouldn't need the cat if... Patience forces a laugh, fills in a ZERO and passes the clipboard to EDNA. The woman puts down the cat food, slip on the reading glasses she wears on a chain around her ne
The application is mostly a formality. I havea sense about people.

Well, I've always liked animals. (not enough) Cats specifically. I mean, I love them... worship them, even. EDNA seems satisfied, returns to reading Patience's answe THE MAU, meanwhile, comes around a corner into the room, peering curiously at Patience -- who dangles her hand invitingly. He rubs his face against her hand. PATIENCE smiles, coos at the cat -- which grabs her hand in his CLAWS. PATIENCE stifles a yelp, yanks her hand bac (CONTINUED )
Son of a --
Excuse me?
Nothing... handsome cat. I've never seen one like him. THE MAU jumps into Patience's lap, settling in. Edna, surprised and almost suspicious, eyes the cat.
Her. That's Midnight, an Egyptian Mau. Normally she doesn't trust people -- EDNA reaches a hand toward MIDNIGHT -- the cat's fur stan up, she HISSES and SWIPES at Edna.
See? Even I can't get near her... Very strange. (glancing at the application) So. You left out your parents' address.
Well... they're both dead.
No hereditary illnesses, I hope.
Private plane crash. I was eleven. Actually, the last thing they gave me was a kitten... Fatso. EDNA sucks her breath in at this insulting name.

He was very round -- not from overfeeding or anything, just -- really, he didn't mind. Anyway, he was with me a long time, till early this year. He didn't come at the sound of the can-opener, which kind of freaked me out... I found him just, curled up there in his little bed... (CONTINUED )
PATIENCE is getting a bit emotional. EDNA reaches across squeezes her hand, with genuine sympathy. MIDNIGHT snuggl into Patience's lap, PURRING as she strokes the cat.

It's very hard, dear, I know... you must be in so much pain. Midnight digs her long NAILS into Patience's thigh, knead PATIENCE winces, tries to dislodge cat's claws from her l -- Midnight "playfully" attacks her hand. Stifling a gasp
Mm-hmm.

Funny how cats get under our skin. They do exactly as they please, they don't care what anyone thinks about them... they're the ultimate predators. So self-contained, so independent, so wild... sometimes I wonder, why do they even put up with us?
The free food?
(putting the papers aside) Well, congratulations. It seems you've been chosen.
So you think you might have a kitten for me...?
Kitten? No, that wouldn't be appropriate. Midnight has chosen you. PATIENCE looks a little unnerved at this. MIDNIGHT, rolli on her back, seems to be baring her fangs at Patience.
It's a great honor. Maus are a very rare breed, descended from the sacred cats of ancient Egypt. They were believed to have magical gifts. (CONTINUED)
MIDNIGHT has wrapped herself around Patience's arm, kicki and biting "playfully."
I'm not sure she likes me --
Nonsense, she perceives something very special in you.
There's nothing special about me.
Cats see things we don't. Our secret selves -- our souls.
Mm. Do you have any Band-Aids? cut TO:

CAMERA MOVES THROUGH this modest, neat studio apartment, a BULLETIN BOARD with numerous PHOTOS. One or two show a YOUNG PATIENCE, there's a picture of a LITTLE GIRL betwee TWO SMILING PARENTS on a ROLLER COASTER. Mostly, though, they're snapshots of a chubby TABBY CAT, from kitten hood old age. Suddenly, MIDNIGHT LUNGES INTO FRAME, attacking picture of FATSO, ripping it from the bulletin board. KEEP MOVING PAST WINDOWS facing on the street and an adja BUILDING across an alley -- it's a corner apartment on th second floor. CAMERA HOLDS ON A TV, where a classic OLD MOVIE like Now, Voyager plays. At a key, romantic moment,
LAUREL AVENAL strides TOWARD CAMERA -- statuesque, perfec supermodel. We hear the VOICE of GEORGES AVENAL:
You know who you are. You know what you're after. A MALE MODEL steps INTO FRAME, reaches for her --
You know you're too good for any man... (CONTINUED )

Laurel raises an eyebrow haughtily and SLAPS his face. Sh Moves past the male model to -- -- GEORGES AVENAL. He's Laurel's husband and the company C.E.O., handsome and charismatic. LAUREL falls into his arms. He caresses her, deeply in love. Georges WINKS.
--. almost. CUT TO a PRODUCT SHOT of a JAR OF CREAM, the name "BEAUNI and the AVENAL LOGO.

Beaunique by Avenal. You know you want it. CLOSE ON LAUREL as she tosses her hair back, Gilda-style, with a seductive pout. She purses her lips in a kiss. REVERSE ANGLE -- PATIENCE watches with a curled lip, on t couch in a T-shirt and shorts, EATING CHOCOLATE ICE CREAM directly from a pint carton, a dark smear around her mout Suddenly, MIDNIGHT POUNCES at the SPOON OF ICE CREAM. Patience jerks back, startled, raises the spoon out of re
No -- this is mine! MIDNIGHT doesn't back off, jumping repeatedly at the spoo climbing over Patience, getting a rear PAW in the open pi

Oh, gross, you -- just take it. Patience offers the cat the half-empty pint. As MIDNIGHT digs in happily, burying his head in the container -- LIGHTS COME ON in the apartment across the way. PATIENCE hesitates only an instant, sticks the spoon in h mouth, CLICKS OFF the TV and flips off a LAMP by the sofa THROUGH THE WINDOW, A HANDSOME MAN -- his name is TOM LON crosses past. PATIENCE sighs in the dark, moving for a better view. Thi voyeurism is a guilty habit. (CONTINUED )
LONE checks his mail, loosens his tie, unbuttons his shir

Welcome home, sweetie. How was work today...? (male voice) Same old same old. All I wanna do is get out of this shirt and give you a big old hug... LONE is distracted, reading his mail, shirt still on. MIDNIGHT, meanwhile, pulls her head out of the ice cream leaps onto the windowsill -- she looks first at Lone, the Patience, who looks around her.
Down in front... Come on, you, off with the shirt. Instead, LONE is moving out of view. PATIENCE moves in th same direction, into her BATHROOM.

THE BATHROOM WINDOW faces into Lone's bedroom. He starts unbutton his shirt, glances casually out the window -- PATIENCE immediately ducks out of sight. A moment later, rises slowly to peek out again -- THE WINDOW is DARK, LONE has turned off THE LIGHT. PATIENCE flips ON THE LIGHT, studies her face in the mirr

Lame, lame, lame. She wipes a bit of chocolate from the corner of her mouth She tries a seductive pout, a la Laurel, gives her hair a seductive toss -- it winds up in her eyes and mouth. ON PATIENCE'S WINDOW -- from across the alley, we see PATIENCE before her mirror, brushing her hair. PULL BACK reveal we're watching with TOM LONE, who spies on Patienc through his own window, lights off. He SIGHS. cut TO:  10.

MOVING CAMERA delivers an assault on the senses: MIRRORS, oversized versions of the BEAUTY PRODUCTS, charts of COLO CHOICES, shelves upon shelves of slickly-packaged COSMETI Prominent is a DISPLAY for BEAUNIQUE. HIP MUSIC in BG. AVENAL GIRLS, perfectly coiffed and made-up Barbie dolls, busily paint the faces of CLIENTS, women of all ages and backgrounds, in high-tech MAKE-UP CHAIRS that resemble torture devices. PATIENCE crosses through, pausing to take off her sneaker and pull on a pair of high heels. SALLY -- an Avenal girl in a prim outfit, working on a matronly CUSTOMER -- looks up to greet PATIENCE. We now see Patience has a small SCRATCH on her cheek, poorly covered with makeup.
Look what the cat dragged in.
(touching her cheek) I know, I know, I'm late -- Midnight thought there was a mouse in my pillow.
This is why I only sleep with my own species. Lunch at Joey's? PATIENCE nods and waves as she hurries through a set of d to an ELEVATOR BANK.

OVERHEAD ANGLE on a rat's maze of office cubicles, people with ACCOUNTING STAFF. FIND PATIENCE tapping at her terminal, sipping COFFEE. It's a grim little space, enlivened by a GARFIELD toy, some New Yorker cartoons. PATIENCE seems bored by the drone work -- then she cocks head at something on the screen, leans closer. She double checks DATA in the print-outs. Something doesn't tally. ON SCREEN -- among a long list of figures, we see "YP-3" highlighted, followed by a series of numbers. PATIENCE gets up quickly with the printouts, she spills a drops of COFFEE on her white blouse. She dabs at these distractedly as she moves through the bullpen toward a glassed-in office. She knocks on the open door, where we the name "D. BERGER - ACCOUNTING." (CONTINUED )

Dave, I was just going over the first quarter expenses. Our lab fees for this one additive -- YP-3 -- have gone through the roof. BERGER, a balding, bespectacled accountant, looks up as Patience moves around his desk to show him some figures.
Look at this, an overage of eight hundred percent on "extruded pellets" alone -- I'm not even sure what that is --
Rat chow. Berger's concerned. As they huddle over the figures, we h a CHOPPER approach. CAMERA MOVES PAST THEM, OUT the WINDO

-- CAMERA SWINGS UP the 40-story skyscraper in the busine district of a city mixing architecture old and new. CAMER PASSES a WINDOW WASHER on a cable-driven rig. NEARING the ROOF, we see a glowing sign which reads "AVENAL BEAUTY" - and a PASSENGER CHOPPER coming in for a landing.

THE CHOPPER touches down on a HELIPAD atop an elevated PENTHOUSE. GEORGES AVENAL emerges, ducking in the blade wash. The company's CEO, Georges is charismatic, handsome immaculately tailored -- an exacting asshole to the core. Getting out of the helicopter behind him, his menacing, silent bodyguard ANGEL carries a leather suitcase or two. LAUREL AVENAL trots toward her husband with open arms. Laurel is 30-something, a still-gorgeous super-model but, person, a tad past her prime. She comes across as sweet a well-meaning, but a bit dim and victimized.
Oh honey, welcome back! She throws her arms around Georges to give him a kiss, bu pushes her away, turns aside to SNEEZE. (CONTINUED )
Are you all right?

My allergies. I thought you were getting rid of that vile dog of yours. GEORGES plucks a long DOG HAIR from her clothes, holds it for her to see, then moves on briskly, down an external flight of stairs from the helipad to a PENTHOUSE below. Laurel follows after him, Angel in the rear.
Georges, when you're gone, Tippy is all I've got and -- I get so lonely.
So get a bird or a fish, something that doesn't shed. (a glance at her) Have you gained weight? They head through glass doors into the PENTHOUSE.
LAUREL protests, examining her body.

No no, it's muscle -- I've been working out, doing my Tae Kwan Do -- She flexes a MUSCLE to demonstrate. GEORGES isn't interested, looking at the penthouse decor with distaste. Meanwhile ANGEL moves to an elevator, presses a down butt and awaits his masters. The penthouse is a large, dramatic space, decorated in a frilly, Louis XIV style -- classical STATUARY of nude females, ornate DRAPERIES across one wall -- there are LADDERS, cans of paint, a work in progress. A large PORTR of LAUREL dominates the room. In one alcove is a MOVIE-ST MAKE-UP MIRROR, surrounded by lights.
What the hell happened here? (CONTINUED )
I'm doing some redecorating, I've had so much time on my hands -- do you like it?
No. What's with the curtains?
Draperies. They soften the space...
I like hard spaces. (off her hurt look) Whatever, Laurel, if it makes you happy. I plan to be spending more time at the factory, anyway. He enters the ELEVATOR, Laurel behind, Angel hits the but

A LARGE GRAPHIC depicts LAUREL and GEORGE together. PATIE curls her lip at this as she presses the DOWN button. DOORS OPEN to reveal the real LAUREL and GEORGES, startli Patience a bit, the impassive ANGEL behind them. Patience takes a half-step forward and hesitates, reluctant to get aboard, frozen in place. The DOORS start to close, then o again -- she's in the way.
In or out? PATIENCE meekly steps into the elevator, presses a button the lobby, nervously keeping her eyes fixed to the front.
GEORGES leans past her to hit "DOOR CLOSE." Many CAT HAIR are sprinkled on her clothes, he SNIFFS and stifles a sne He looks Patience over, and doesn't like what he sees.
Excuse me, miss. Do you know who I am? (CONTINUED )
Um... of course. You're Georges Avenal -- you own the company --
Then you actually work for me. Are you familiar with our products?
Yes sir, I just can't really afford them --
You can afford some peroxide, can't you? Do something about this mousy hair. GEORGES runs a hand distastefully through her frizzy hair then takes a moment to study her.

Stain on your blouse, run in your pantyhose -- and that color's awful on you. (fingering her outfit) Do you own an iron? Show me your hands. Shaking, Patience extends her hands. Georges inspects her trembling fingers. He seems saddened, clucks his tongue.
A nail-biter... my my, you really are the "before" picture, aren't you?
I could give her the number for my manicurist --
(waving Laurel off) What's your name?
Patience...
I haven't got all day -- (CONTINUED )
No, my name's Patience, Patience Price. I'm in accounting.
I'm afraid that's no excuse. Regardless of your position, you do represent Avenal Beauty. I simply can't allow that to continue.
Wait. You're not -- firing me?

I have no choice. All we have to sell is an image -- and you are not it. You've got to go. DING! The DOOR OPENS. Patience stares at the man in disbelief, then bolts out into the SHOWROOM. STAY WITH GEORGES, LAUREL and ANGEL as the doors close.
Poor girl. GEORGES studies Laurel's face a moment, leans closer, ama
Is that a pimple?

A retro place, PATIENCE and SALLY sit in a booth over SAL and SODAS. Sally leans across the table, fixing Patience' make-up -- her mascara's run from crying, her nose is red An open MAKE-UP POUCH rests between them.
I try, Sally, I really do. I read Vogue, I wear uncomfortable shoes... I've been a female all my life, you'd think I'd be better at it by now.
Watch the frown lines, you'll need a lift before you're forty. (CONTINUED )
She opens 16.
He's right, I'm not even presentable enough to be an accountant. Maybe the church needs a new bell- ringer.
Look, he was just in a bad mood. Sales are down, his marriage is on the rocks --
How do you know that?
I have an enquiring mind. This is "Nympho," very hot, I snagged it from the showroom... a tube of LIPSTICK, starts applying it expertly to Patience's lips as she speaks.
Laurel's losing her looks, she's dumber than her cockapoo buzz is, Georges is trading her in for next year's model. All I'm saying is, by now he's probably forgotten about canning you.
I don't care. No way am I going back there.
Shut up, you'll smear... voila, now suck your finger. Patience puts her finger in her mouth, pulls it out with pop, to keep the lipstick off her teeth. She studies the residue on her finger.
I can't believe we put this stuff on our mouths. Grease, acid and ground-up fish scales... who knows what they put in our mascara...
No wonder you never made it in sales. ANGLE THROUGH WINDOW BEHIND THEM, as a long LIMOUSINE pas  17.

LAUREL is fixing her make-up meticulously in a COMPACT MIRROR, looking for signs of the dreaded zit. GEORGES is flipping through AD LAYOUT BOARDS. WESLEY, a weasely ASSISTANT, is seated between them, going over an electron appointment book. A CHAUFFEUR, ANGEL in the passenger sea
You're both scheduled to appear at the Make-Overs for the Homeless event on the 25th --
Ugh. That one's yours, Laurel.
The ballet opens the following Friday --
(re: the ad boards) These look good, Wesley, send them back to the agency. LAUREL closes the compact, leans across to catch a glimps
May I see?
You wouldn't be interested.
Please, Georges? She tugs a board away, then sucks in her breath seeing -- AN AD featuring DRINA, a gorgeous young model, nearly nud We see a tube of MASCARA with the AVENAL LOGO.
That's Drina.
She's... pretty.
She's magnificent. GEORGES takes the board back, LAUREL looks a little sick. (CONTINUED )
Well, I'm still the face of Avenal... aren't I?

(smiling indulgently) You've had a remarkably long shelf life, it's true. But... every product has an expiration date. Laurel bites her lip, looks out the window, close to tear A PHONE is ringing, ANGEL answers in front. Georges' hand are still full with the ads piled around him.
Uh, sir, it's Dave Berger in accounting.
Who? I don't talk to bean-counters.
He says it's urgent.
All right, Angel, put it on speaker.
BERGER peers at his TERMINAL, a half-eaten SANDWICH nearb He's marked up the PRINT-OUTS that Patience brought him.
(on phone) Mr. Avenal -- I hate to bother you, sir, but we have a problem. It seems the lab has been overproducing YP-3 -- that's the anti-aging ingredient in Beaunique --
Why are you telling me this? It's routine to have a surplus -- (CONTINUED )
We've stockpiled over a thousand gallons, enough to last us well into the 29th Century.
Perhaps that is a trifle optimistic --
And very expensive. Funding seems to have been siphoned out of the employee pension plan --
Impossible, this has to be an error. Are you responsible for this data?
Well, actually Patience Price brought the matter to my attention --
Yes, yes, I'm familiar with Ms. Price. Obviously her bookkeeping is as sloppy as her appearance.
Sir, she's a very reliable employee --
I've heard enough, Berger. In the future, double- check your figures before you waste my time -- and then put it in a memo.
(on phone) In all fairness, Mr. Avenal, I think -- BEEP. He's talking to a dial tone. Berger hangs up, frustrated and chagrined. cut TO:  20.
START on a JEWELRY DISPLAY, a ritzy DIAMOND NECKLACE. SALLY's face appears in the window, beaming.
Wow... sorry, Patience, I just found a new best friend. PATIENCE, beside her, WHISTLES appreciatively, then moves
I'm sick of drooling over things I'll never have. The two are WINDOW-SHOPPING, passing a SHOE STORE, boots and high-heels... A WESTERNWEAR SHOP, belt buckles, WHIPS
Oh, you're a ray of sunshine. Tell you what, let me take you clubbing this weekend --
I'm not sure I'm fit to be seen in public.

You will be in that dress. I've had my eye on it for weeks. SALLY points at a MANNEQUIN in the window of a trendy boutique, garbed in a dramatic, sexy outfit -- a short bodice, a tiny skirt, plenty of plastic skin showing.
Sally, that is not a dress, it's a rumor of a dress. It's barely forensic evidence of a dress.
It's a genuine Gaultier knock-off --
It's not me.
But don't you ever wanna be somebody else?
I just wish I could be ten years old again -- it didn't matter what I wore as long as I could climb a tree in it. (CONTINUED)
Your tomboy days are over.
That's my bus, Sal, see you later. PATIENCE trots toward a BUS, SALLY calls after her.

This weekend, Patience. I swear, I'm gonna make you have fun if it kills you... As Sally moves on, CAMERA LINGERS ON the window of A LING STORE, scantily-clad MANNEQUINS, including one in BLACK UNDIES and a CAT MASK.
DAVE BERGER, the accountant, dressed casually, gets out o CAB and heads into his modest home.
Berger SNIFFS the air quizzically as he lets himself in. He moves toward the KITCHEN. In the kitchen DOORWAY, he fumbles for a LIGHT SWITCH, flicks it on and --
KA-BOOM! The WINDOWS BLOW OUT with a HUGE EXPLOSION. ACROSS THE STREET, a BLACK MERCEDES pulls from the curb, HEADLIGHTS OFF, and ACCELERATES away. cut TO:

PATIENCE moves to her apartment door, arms loaded with GROCERIES. She struggles to unlock the door while keeping these upright -- we see a "HELLO KITTY" emblem on her key chain. As soon as the door is open -- -- MIDNIGHT BOLTS out into the hall, a black streak movin toward the stairs and darting upward. (CONTINUED )

Midnight! You little monster -- Patience tosses her groceries in the door, leaving it aja and runs after the cat. A few moments after she's vanished up the stairs, we hear FOOTSTEPS from below and... ANGEL, Georges Avenal's menacing bodyguard, appears in th hallway. He moves purposefully for Patience's door, pushe it open and steps inside. Midnight just saved her neck.
MIDNIGHT makes for an open hall window that leads onto a ESCAPE. Patience just spots her heading outside.
Oh no...
Patience reaches the window just in time to see -- MIDNIGHT make a SPECTACULAR LEAP across the alleyway and -- -- LAND ON TOM LONE'S BALCONY. PATIENCE is annoyed, but also impressed, in spite of hers
Hell of a jump...
ANGEL flings open the closet and bathroom doors in Patien empty apartment -- no dice. On his way out, he eyes a pla of cat food and ice cream with a wince.
Patience clumsily CLAMBERS up Lone's RATTLING FIRE ESCAPE reaches the level Midnight is on, moves toward the cat. (CONTINUED )
You are not worth the trouble -- Suddenly, a WINDOW FLIES OPEN, just a foot away, a GUN po in her face. Patience lets out a CRY, jumps back --
Freeze! It's TOM LONE. But Patience loses her balance, FALLS -- -- and LANDS in an open DUMPSTER. LONE darts from the window, alarmed, realizing his error.

ANGEL emerges, shaking his head and shrugging toward the unseen driver of the BLACK MERCEDES, then he climbs in th passenger door. As the car pulls away -- -- LONE hurries from the building next-door toward the al
PATIENCE painfully gets upright, slipping in the trash, a LONE appears; he's a no-nonsense, gruff cop with a dry wi
You all right? He clambers onto the dumpster's edge to help her out, she slips and slides, almost pulls him in after her.

I'm really sorry -- I'm a police officer, I heard the noise and just assumed... here, grab my arm. He manages to hoist Patience to the lip, she's able to cl to the ground. She's drenched in GOOEY GARBAGE, just star at Lone, a bit dazed from the fall. She can't believe she face to face with the man of her dreams. Lone thinks a be
Habla espanol? (CONTINUED )
She blinks at him, confused, then he tentatively flashes few HAND SIGNS for the deaf. She waves this off.
No, I -- see, my cat got out -- MIDNIGHT MEWS, rubs against Patience's leg. She picks the cat up, nods toward her window.
I live right up there --
I know.
You do?
I mean, I -- I've seen you. Around.
Really. Actually, I've seen you too. Around, that is. (a nod at the dumpster) Thanks for helping me out.

Don't mention it. I can't resist a damsel in distress. PATIENCE smiles and cocks her head... flirtatious body language. She runs a hand through her hair, pulls out som sticky TISSUE PAPER, looks at it with disgust.
Oh God, what -- what is that?! He looks over her shoulder, winces.
I could run it over to the lab... She tosses it in the dumpster, finally registering that s drenched in WET GARBAGE.
I'm sorry, it was nice talking to you, but -- I'm completely disgusting. (CONTINUED )
Mortified, she hurries back to the entrance to her buildi Lone looks after her, amused. cut TO:

SPOTLIGHTS before a NIGHTCLUB, a CROWD behind a VELVET RO A HANDSOME BOUNCER stands guard. SALLY AND PATIENCE are n the front of the line. Sally has transformed herself, wit heavy make-up, a revealing skin-tight outfit that shows plenty of cleavage. Patience is in a conservative dress, she might wear to work. Sally HOWLS with LAUGHTER at something Patience has just said. Patience looks grim.
It isn't funny.
